Does anybody know where to find a new brain? mine just explode.
Apparently i’ll need to watch it more than once to get it but for a first time watch it was interesting
I had to take a break in the middle of the movie and finish watching it the next day because it was too much for me😭

This is not just a movie for me but a dimension that takes me away from this world, that shows me elements of hope and love which I have never witnessed in my life. The greatest cosmic Creation of cinema by Nolan.

I love how vast space feels in this film. Also, I learned a fun fact the other day about the black hole scene. Despite being entirely a computer generated rendering, they added lens flare and other details so that the shot would match the iMax cameras that the rest of the movie was shot in. I thought that was pretty neat.

This movie is an absolute must watch, it has stunning visual effects, with perfect music and sound effects. The movie creates an atmosphere that is very intriguing and it is hard to look away.  The acting is also on point, with Mathew McConaughey and Matt Damon delivering an incredible performance.   Absolute 10/10 Cinema

It was more than a movie, it felt like a journey through time and space. Every detail was perfect, the stunning performances, and Hans Zimmer’s music, which isn’t just heard but felt, like the very heartbeat of the universe. What impressed me the most was the cinematography scenes that touch the depths of space and make you feel your own smallness in the face of the universe’s vastness.

“Cooper, they didn’t bring us here to change the past.” “Say that again?” “They didn’t bring us here to change the past.”  I’ve been putting this movie off for a while, I thought it was going to be just another overrated movie. Turns out, it wasn’t.  The first 30 or so minutes weren’t entertaining — like at all. Though I’m glad I pushed through and managed to finish this because it’s amazing.  The little easter eggs, such as the ticks… more

Interstellar bukan hanya tentang luar angkasa. Tapi ia memperlihatkan bagaimana waktu bisa menjadi sesuatu yang kejam, diam, tapi pasti.  Tidak ada banyak kata yang dilebihkan. Justru yang terasa adalah jeda, penundaan, dan tahun-tahun yang berlalu tanpa bisa ditunggu. Film ini berjalan pelan, tenang, dan seolah membiarkan kita sendiri dengan pikiran kita.  Interstellar tidak sibuk membuat kita terkesima. Ia membuat kita sadar: bahwa kehilangan tidak selalu datang dari perpisahan, tapi dari waktu yang terus berjalan saat kita tidak ada di sana.  Ini film yang selesai di layar, tapi tertinggal lama di dada. Bukan karena apa yang ditampilkan, melainkan karena apa yang tidak sempat diucapkan.

Christopher Nolan films have always frustrated and made me cringe, but I could never explain why until now, I think.  I love metaphysical art work and story telling. I love stuff like Slaughterhouse Five by Kurt Vonnegut and The Crying of Lot 49 by Thomas Pynchon and obviously David Lynch movies, but Nolan’s stuff is different in that it feels like it’s capitulating to be a mainstream movie. I don’t necessarily think that’s a bad thing cause I also love… more

Interstellar (2014)  This is a tough one to rate. In many ways, the movie is close to flawless. Performances and casting feel spot on. The effects are beyond superb. The spectacle of it blows you away, particularly in the correct viewing environment. There are twists, stakes, consequences—albeit perhaps a small plot hole or two, an incongruity in the advancement of technology on Earth, and a world I would’ve like to have learned a touch more about given the scope and… more

Interstellar – A Film That Grows With You  Interstellar isn’t just a movie. It’s a lifetime companion.  It’s a rare masterpiece I can re-watch anytime, in any mood. I’ve seen it in a theatre, in IMAX, on my TV, PC, and even on my mobile, dozens of times. And here’s the insane part: every single rewatch still excites me. I want to go back to it. That alone separates this film from 99% of cinema.  Each time I return to… more

(10/10)  I mean come on. We're talking about Interstellar.  - Other than Dallas Buyer's club, this is McConaughey's best performance. The rest of the cast is exquisite as well. - Timothee Chalamet turning into Casey Affleck is a bigger twist than the end. - Hans Zimmer performs one of the most epic and heartfelt scores of all time. - The story is perfect beginning to end. - The massive wave brings me more stress than most thrillers can offer. - Space is sick. - The twist ending when he's stuck in the bookshelf ties together the brilliance of this movie.  Christopher Nolan's best work.

"near perfection"  Fourth watch of Interstellar and I am still in awe of this film! The music from Hans Zimmer, is the best I have ever experienced in a movie. The story just keeps on expanding and is so well constructed. McConaughey was in my opinion at the top of the industry these years; an outstanding performance.  The vast amount of themes this movie covers in such a brilliant way. With stunning visuals of space supporting it. A must watch for anyone in my opinion.

Eso si, me costó encontrar el sentido o mejor dicho la trama de la película porque en mi opinión es bastante confusa en algunos aspectos pero la recomiendo totalmente.   10/10

Christopher Nolan’s Interstellar has now become the second of his films that required a return visit for me to fully appreciate — a pattern I’m beginning to recognize in my relationship with his work. Only on this revisit, years after my initial viewing, did the film’s ambitions begin to cohere. Even then, I found myself consulting breakdowns and brushing up on physics to grasp some of its more intricate mechanics.  What’s striking is that the elements that appear most superficial… more

Interstellar é absurdo de bom. A história é magnífica e eu amo como o filme vai se desenrolando com uns plot twists absurdos. É real aquele tipo de filme que você não consegue prever nada e isso deixa tudo ainda mais interessante. A única coisa que eu senti um pouco de falta foi de desenvolver mais a Murphy. A construção dela é ótima, mas acho que dava pra explorar mais a trajetória dela.

Que filme desgraçado. Eu consegui sentir o desespero, a angústia de ficar sozinho e saber que fora daquela nave não há nada além de um vasto espaço que se você errar um cálculo pode acabar morto. A sensação de perder tempo, perder anos da sua vida por uma coisa que nem foi realmente planejada doeu em mim, ver seus filhos crescerem e ver as coisas mudando enquanto você continua praticamente a mesma pessoa pode deixar alguém realmente maluco. Thoughts:   “Matthew McConaughey plays a scientist…” Yeah, I’m gonna stop you right there.   When they’re fighting on Hoth 2.0, I really wanted the Star Trek fight music to play.   For a film with this much science, it’s really pretty dumb. The characters speak only in exposition (which is just as well, as they are often drowned out by music) and are completely underdeveloped.  Visually impressive, occasionally moving.   Another example of spectacle over story.

no me caben las palabras para describir lo que es esta película y mas el tiempo que estuvo en mi lista de espera, no debi retrasarla tanto pero vaya que me sorprendió esta película, tanto sus visuales como la historia me encanto, y me vuela la cabeza todos los conceptos que nos introdujieron durante todo el film no dara detalles sobre la trama solo me encantaria una segunda parte.

Interestelar tem uma ideia muito interessante e a cinematografia é impecável, visualmente é muito foda, mas o filme é arrastado em vários momentos e a direção deixa a desejar em como constrói a tensão, ocorre vários furos de roteiro que fazem a história ficar entre ciência e drama, parece que o filme não se decide e não sustenta o propósito que quer, tentando misturar emoções e conceitos científicos de forma confusa. Favourite movie oat. It’s so insanely cinematographically beautiful, the story is incredible. Watching it a second time was CRAZY the stuff i picked up which i wouldn’t have otherwise is so crazy. It might be the only near 3 hour film which keeps me sat up the whole time, had me holding my breath even when i knew what was gonna happen. So emotional too and the soundtrack is just perfect. The metaphor of gravity for love is beautiful and i do interpret the ending as not literally just wow. FURTHERMORE the acting is just phenomenal too its hands down my favourite film
